Hysterical

Women's Stand-up Comedy

women who rule the stage

For a long time, humor was considered a domain exclusive to men, and men feared being laughed at. Later, women took the stage, and their work was ridiculed as being "too feminine" in theme. Now, generation after generation of brave women comedians have drawn inspiration from their own experiences, using humor to fight against injustice.

specials

Taylor Tomlinson: Have It All (2024)

Taylor Tomlinson talks dream jobs, finding a perfect partner and dealing with anxiety, while asking the age-old question: "Can you really have it all?"

Cristela Alonzo: Lower Classy (2017)

The irrepressible Alonzo skewers Latino stereotypes, pricey luxuries and her mother's tough-love parenting in a night of sly and infectious comedy.

Hannah Gadsby: Nanette (2018)

Australian comic Hannah Gadsby reshapes standard stand-up by pairing punchlines with personal revelations on gender, sexuality and childhood turmoil.
